characters.name: Mia Fey
characters.description1: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
characters.description2: The victim. Chief attorney at Fey & Co. Law Offices, and an excellent defense lawyer.

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: Mia's little sister. Found bent over her sister's body, crying.
characters.description2: The defendant. Mia's little sister, and a spirit medium in training.
characters.description3: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.

characters.name: Dick Gumshoe
characters.description1: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.

characters.name: Miles Edgeworth
characters.description1: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.

characters.name: April May
characters.description1: An eye witness to the events. Testifies that she saw Maya commit the murder.
characters.description2: Stayed with someone else in the hotel on the night of the murder. Tapped Mia's phone.

characters.name: Marvin Grossberg
characters.description1: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.

characters.name: Bellboy
characters.description1: Bellboy at the Gatewater Hotel.
characters.description2: Delivered room service to Miss May at the time of the murder. Also checked her in.

characters.name: Redd White
characters.description1: An eye witness. CEO of the information gathering company, Bluecorp.

evidence_objects.name: Attorney's Badge
evidence_objects.description1: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.

evidence_objects.name: The Thinker
evidence_objects.description1: The murder weapon. Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock. Made by Larry Butz.
evidence_objects.description2: Clock in the form of a statue. The clock's gears have been removed. Made by Larry Butz.

evidence_objects.name: Glass Shards
evidence_objects.description1: The broken remains of a glass light stand. Broken beyond all recognition.

evidence_objects.name: Receipt
evidence_objects.description1: A department store receipt with letters written in blood on the back.
evidence_objects.description2: Receipt for a glass light stand. The date of purchase is the day before the murder.

evidence_objects.name: Maya's Memo
evidence_objects.description1: "A conversation I had with my sister is recorded on my cell phone."

evidence_objects.name: Mia's Autopsy Report
evidence_objects.description1: Time of death: 9/5 at 9:00PM. Cause: single blunt force trauma. Death was instantaneous.
evidence_objects.description2: Died from a blow by a blunt object. May have lived for a few minutes after being hit.

evidence_objects.name: Maya's Cell Phone
evidence_objects.description1: Holds a conversation between the Chief and Maya. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Wiretap
evidence_objects.description1: Found in Miss May's hotel room.

evidence_objects.name: Floor Plans
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence during the trial.
evidence_objects.description1: The murder scene, the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: May Testimony
evidence_objects.description1: "The victim dodged an attack then ran to the right, but she was caught and struck."

evidence_objects.name: Photograph
evidence_objects.description1: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" are written in pencil.

evidence_objects.name: Photograph
evidence_objects.description1: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B" are written in pencil.

evidence_objects.name: Bellboy's Affidavit
evidence_objects.description1: Describes the man who stayed with Miss May in the hotel on the night of the murder.

evidence_objects.name: Newspaper Clipping
evidence_objects.description1: Article about politician's suicide. The word "White" is written in pen at the top.

evidence_objects.name: Mia's Memo
evidence_objects.description1: A list of people's names in Mia's handwriting.

testimonies.testimony: I did see everything! I did!
The victim--the woman--dodged the first attack and ran off to the right.
Then the girl in the hippie clothes ran after her...
And she hit her with that weapon! I saw it! I did!
That... that clock! Um... the kinda statue-y clock? "The Thinker," I think?

source.evidence_span: Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock.
source.testimony_span: That... that clock! Um... the kinda statue-y clock?
source.explanation: One cannot know by looking that the statue is a clock.

context:
Turnabout Sisters









Transcript

Transcript (JP)Part 1

Part 2

Part 3

Part 4Episode 2Turnabout SistersCellular:
Brrring... Brrrrring...*beep*???:
Hello? This is Maya.Mia:
Hey Maya, it's me.???:
Mia! What's up? You haven't called in a while.Mia:
Sorry, I've been so busy. How you been????:
Well, LONELY. And it's all YOUR fault. Nah, I'm just teasing. I've been great! I'm finally getting used to having my own place.Mia:
That's good to hear. Actually, I'm calling because I have a favor to ask.???:
I know, I know. You want me to hold evidence for you?Mia:
Sharp as always! There's a lot of buzz about the upcoming trial... I just don't feel safe keeping the evidence here.???:
I gotcha. So, what is it this time?Mia:
It's... a clock.???:
A clock?Mia:
Yeah, it's made to look like that statue, "The Thinker." And it tells you the time! I thought you might like it. You always liked toys.???:
Hey! I'm not a little girl anymore, Sis!Mia:
Now, now. You know I'm only teasing. Ah, I should probably tell you, the clock isn't talking right now.???:
Huh? It's not working? That's lame!Mia:

characters.name: Mia Fey
characters.description1: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
characters.description2: The victim. Chief attorney at Fey & Co. Law Offices, and an excellent defense lawyer.

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: Mia's little sister. Found bent over her sister's body, crying.
characters.description2: The defendant. Mia's little sister, and a spirit medium in training.
characters.description3: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.

characters.name: Dick Gumshoe
characters.description1: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.

characters.name: Miles Edgeworth
characters.description1: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.

characters.name: April May
characters.description1: An eye witness to the events. Testifies that she saw Maya commit the murder.
characters.description2: Stayed with someone else in the hotel on the night of the murder. Tapped Mia's phone.

characters.name: Marvin Grossberg
characters.description1: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.

characters.name: Bellboy
characters.description1: Bellboy at the Gatewater Hotel.
characters.description2: Delivered room service to Miss May at the time of the murder. Also checked her in.

characters.name: Redd White
characters.description1: An eye witness. CEO of the information gathering company, Bluecorp.

evidence_objects.name: Attorney's Badge
evidence_objects.description1: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.

evidence_objects.name: The Thinker
evidence_objects.description1: The murder weapon. Looks like a statue, but it's actually a clock. Made by Larry Butz.
evidence_objects.description2: Clock in the form of a statue. The clock's gears have been removed. Made by Larry Butz.

evidence_objects.name: Glass Shards
evidence_objects.description1: The broken remains of a glass light stand. Broken beyond all recognition.

evidence_objects.name: Receipt
evidence_objects.description1: A department store receipt with letters written in blood on the back.
evidence_objects.description2: Receipt for a glass light stand. The date of purchase is the day before the murder.

evidence_objects.name: Maya's Memo
evidence_objects.description1: "A conversation I had with my sister is recorded on my cell phone."

evidence_objects.name: Mia's Autopsy Report
evidence_objects.description1: Time of death: 9/5 at 9:00PM. Cause: single blunt force trauma. Death was instantaneous.
evidence_objects.description2: Died from a blow by a blunt object. May have lived for a few minutes after being hit.

evidence_objects.name: Maya's Cell Phone
evidence_objects.description1: Holds a conversation between the Chief and Maya. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: Wiretap
evidence_objects.description1: Found in Miss May's hotel room.

evidence_objects.name: Floor Plans
evidence_objects.obtained: Submitted as evidence during the trial.
evidence_objects.description1: The murder scene, the Fey & Co. Law Offices. Click here for details.

evidence_objects.name: May Testimony
evidence_objects.description1: "The victim dodged an attack then ran to the right, but she was caught and struck."

evidence_objects.name: Photograph
evidence_objects.description1: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" are written in pencil.

evidence_objects.name: Photograph
evidence_objects.description1: On the back the words "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit B" are written in pencil.

evidence_objects.name: Bellboy's Affidavit
evidence_objects.description1: Describes the man who stayed with Miss May in the hotel on the night of the murder.

evidence_objects.name: Newspaper Clipping
evidence_objects.description1: Article about politician's suicide. The word "White" is written in pen at the top.

evidence_objects.name: Mia's Memo
evidence_objects.description1: A list of people's names in Mia's handwriting.

testimonies.testimony: I am the head bellboy at the fine Gatewater Hotel, in business for four generations!
I believe I received a call after 8:00 in the evening from our guest, Miss May.
She asked for an ice coffee to be brought to her at 9:00, on the dot, sir.
I brought it to her at precisely the requested time, of course.
And I delivered the ice coffee to our guest Miss May, herself.
